questions.question: Which operational decision would affect a shipping company's functionality?
choices: The design and layout of depots
The location and size of depots

questions.question: Why do companies outsource distribution operations?
choices: To make logistics a core competency

questions.question: How are fourth-party logistics (4PL) provider solutions delivered?
choices: Across specific parts of the supply chain

questions.question: Which type of transportation mode is optimal for shipping a package containing an expensive antique vase a very long distance?
Which surcharge is used to account for variations in marine fuel pricing?
What are the two key factors used in the selection of the most appropriate type of road transport for a large shipment?

A company is distributing four products (A, B, C, and D) with the following volume-to-weight ratios:
Product Volume-to-weight ratio
A 100, B 600, C 1000, D 250
Which product is relatively the most efficient for distribution?
Which stage of the product life cycle (PLC) function has the greatest positive slope?
A skincare company is facing a large amount of fluctuation in the demand for its products. Which operational means of production strategy should the company use in this situation?

A large chemical company produces a water treatment chemical that is used in the purification process for municipal water treatment facilities. Which manufacturing process should the chemical company use?
Which type of company performance ability minimizes waste in its production process?
A company is reengineering its logistics network by lowering costs. How will this action affect the network?

A supermarket chain produces its own brand of food products that it uses as a replacement for brand-name items when stock levels are low. The products are essentially identical to those it purchases from brand-name manufacturers. What is the result of this strategy for the supermarket chain?
What happens to product sales in the introductory phase of the product life cycle (PLC)?
choices: They decrease at an increasing rate.
They increase at an increasing rate.
They increase at a decreasing rate.
They decrease at a decreasing rate.
questions.correct: They increase at an increasing rate.

questions.question: Which type of logistics should a company interested in improving its recycling operations focus on?

A companyâ€™s distribution center receives large shipments from its manufacturing plants, which are then shipped out as smaller shipments to customers. Which type of operation is the distribution center using?
A government entity sets a road tax exemption for electric vehicles. What is this type of government action called?
What is the most efficient way of minimizing empty miles in transportation?
choices: Picking up large and infrequent lots from suppliers
Picking up lots from suppliers after drop-off to customers
Picking up small and frequent lots from suppliers
Picking up large lots from suppliers and dropping off small lots to customers
questions.correct: Picking up lots from suppliers after drop-off to customers

questions.question: Which cross-border logistics decision will affect an organizations customs tax liabilities?
Which agency helps prepare and submit customs declarations on behalf of an importer or exporter?
Which international law focuses on harmonizing customs procedures throughout the world?
choices: Infringement and Amended Foreign Trade Act (IFTA)
Prevention of Corruption in Tariffs and Trade (PCTT)

questions.question: What is one of the goals of the Kyoto customs convention?
choices: To build more opaque customs procedures
To discourage preferences for trusted organizations
To make customs procedures more predictable
questions.correct: To make customs procedures more predictable

questions.question: Which factor helps define and categorize customs tariff rates?

A small business needs to cross a bridge in a delivery van to transport its products across the international border to a neighboring country. Which practice can the business use to assist the international agencies stationed there to ensure the efficient clearance of the products across the border?
choices: Assuming tariff consistency for different countries
Consolidating and paying duties aTone time

questions.question: A busy international shipping company needs to hire a customs and trade compliance manager and is creating an employment request for its human resources team. Which skill will the applicant need to be successful in this role?
choices: The ability to ensure successful systems deployment for vigorous trade operations
The ability to implement best practices for lowering its excise tax obligations
The ability to assist with the customization and trading of finished goods
The ability to provide a strategy for lowering direct taxes
questions.correct: The ability to ensure successful systems deployment for vigorous trade operations

questions.question: What is a characteristic of the Corrupt Practice Act of 1977?
choices: It encourages the use of diverse payment types used to retain business.
It involves the use of corporations making unsanctioned payments both inside and outside the country.
It encourages the use of diverse payment types used to obtain original business.
It involves the use of unsanctioned payments made by multinational corporations but not individuals.
questions.correct: It involves the use of corporations making unsanctioned payments both inside and outside the country.

questions.question: What is a key component of the supply cost that is specific to international trade?
Which supply chain strategy is used to address demand changes using an agile method?
What is one of the benefits of efficient consumer response (ECR) in global trade?

A country with an economy that is highly dependent on garment manufacturing and retail is having a problem with its border control mechanisms. Which challenge will a garment manufacturing company face while doing business with this country?
choices: Increased production costs for the manufacturer
Increased financial risks for raw material suppliers
Increased product loss in the market

questions.question: Which agency helps in improving safety in the international trade and supply chain?

A manager is planning inventory by calculating the average demand for products for the next production period based on the actual demand from the previous two years. Which quantitative forecasting method is the manager using?

A manufacturing company keeps partially finished stock at a nearby suppliers warehouse to ensure that stock deliveries can be made within an hour and goods can be completed and shipped to customers immediately. Which stock type is being held at the warehouse?
A company holds stock supplies that are equivalent to the typical demand required to meet frequent customer purchases for one quarter. Which stock type does the firm hold?

Using the Pareto analysis, a manager makes a policy decision that says product lines that are sold quickly will be available at all distribution centers at a 90% availability level. Which category does the manager assign to these product lines?
A manager discovers that each time an order is transported to customers, the delivery vehicle returns empty, which increases costs. How could the firm decrease costs by optimizing the return journey?
choices: By visiting customers to discuss new products
By collecting raw materials on the return trip
By outsourcing delivery to a dedicated third party
By investing in more distribution facilities
questions.correct: By collecting raw materials on the return trip

questions.question: A companys distribution process moves goods from the production facility to the warehouse, to local distribution centers, and then on to customers. Which distribution process is the company using?

A manager learns that the manufacturing plant has half of the required inventory to complete a customers order and calculates the penalty for not holding adequate stock. Which element of inventory-holding cost is the manager analyzing?
A firm rapidly increases its variety of goods, requiring it to order a larger assortment of inventory. Which factor is influencing rising inventory costs?

A manager evaluates key performance indicators related to cost centers and operations standards and compares the variance between actual costs and performance data to take corrective action. What is the manager evaluating?

A manager is evaluating the effectiveness of an operations control system and discovers that the data does not include all the products stages of production and distribution that are necessary to make decisions. Which principle associated with the system should be a concern?

A firm is establishing a measurement system to evaluate the effectiveness of its operational functions. Managers with different levels of policy and decision-making authority will be contributing to and implementing improvements based on the data produced by the system. Which best practice should the firm consider as it develops its measurement system?

A company identifies world-class standards used by other companies in a variety of global industries to establish a fundamental measure of its operating efficiency compared to other organizations to identify variances that will allow it to employ continuous improvements and close performance gaps. Which process is the firm engaged in?

A company uses technology to control all activities, automated equipment, and radio frequency communications with operators in its finished-goods distribution centers. Which system is the company using?
A firm donates materials to an aid agency following a natural disaster and asks to be notified when the materials have reached the final end users. When will the aid agency contact the firm?
choices: When materials have been transported onsite
When materials have reached the extended delivery point
When the overall impact reporTon the aid is complete

questions.question: A community college raises funds to support humanitarian aid in another country that is experiencing a famine. Which role does the community college play?
A firm uses a balanced scorecard approach to measure its learning and innovation perspective related to the impact of research and developmenTon new-to-market goods. Which metric does the firm use?
A firm uses an online system to contract transportation that is similar to an online trading platform used for logistics that is hosted by a third-party agency. Which platform is the firm using?
A firm monitors all its distribution centers to determine how expenses such as labor and rent vary from location to location. Which performance indicator does the firm monitor?
A firm uses a formal benchmarking system that considers the requirements of the companys customers and focuses on improving supplier performance for consumers. Which system does the firm use?

A firm uses a formal benchmarking framework that applies standards based on productivity and operational performance excellence officially recognized in the United States. Which framework is the firm using?
choices: Logmark Supply Chain Benchmarking Group criteria
Malcolm Baldridge National Quality Award criteria
questions.correct: Malcolm Baldridge National Quality Award criteria

questions.question: A manufacturer wants to streamline its operations and focus on its core business area and decides to outsource its distribution and logistics to a third party. How will this decision impact the manufacturer?
choices: It will cause a decrease in direct product profitability.
It will reduce the flexibility of warehouse management.
It will reduce the effectiveness of inventory demand forecasting systems.
It will cause a decrease in logistics decision-making control.
questions.correct: It will cause a decrease in logistics decision-making control.

questions.question: A manufacturer decides to outsource its distribution and logistics to a third party to provide facilities, distribution centers, and transport vehicles. What is the impact of this decision on the manufacturer?
choices: It will provide the ability to reduce the product life cycle through innovation.
It will increase product proliferation as a result of cost savings.
It will decrease demand volatility as a result of business planning.
It will provide investment opportunities in more profitable business areas.
questions.correct: It will provide investment opportunities in more profitable business areas.

questions.question: A firm has decided to use a multiuser third-party distribution and logistics agency. Which advantage is gained from this decision?
choices: Economies of scale can be achieved with other firms.
Benchmarking will be provided by the third party.
Agency staff possesses general knowledge of operations management.
Equipment will meet basic operations requirements.
questions.correct: Economies of scale can be achieved with other firms.

questions.question: A firm with a strong reputation for quality has decided to outsource its distribution and logistics operations to a multiuser third-party agency start-up that is not well known in the industry. Which scenario is the firm likely to experience as a result of this decision?
choices: The third-party firm will improve the end-user customer experience.
The third-party brand could interfere with the firms brand.
Omnichannel fulfillment will improve through collaboration.
Benchmarking with competitive logistics firms will be effective.
questions.correct: The third-party brand could interfere with the firms brand.

questions.question: A firm decides to outsource its operations management functions. Which first step should the firm take to consider this relationship?
choices: Conduct open-book audits with the provider

questions.question: A third-party distribution and logistics provider decides to scale back from serving multiple users to serving as a dedicated outsourcing firm. Which capability allows the firm to charge more for its services?
choices: Reduced risk cost related to product obsolescence
Economies of scale with other firms
Consolidation of loads and higher delivery frequency

questions.question: A firm has established an outsourcing relationship and monitors the achievement of provider activity targets during review meetings that include open-book audits with different levels of decision-makers. What is the firm engaged in?

A firm writes a clause into a contract with a third-party logistics provider that the provider will receive a percentage of the profits whenever the provider exceeds its performance targets. Which approach is the firm using?

A warehouse manager wants to connect the picking operations to its warehouse management system (WMS) to eliminate human intervention from its operations. Which type of inventory management system can help the manager?
A company is evaluating its options for storing long turbine blades in a warehouse with minimal investment costs. Which storage system should the company use?
A home utensils company wants to reduce its direct labor costs in its warehouse operations. Which warehouse activity should the company focus on to drive the biggest reduction?
Two pickers in a warehouse have picking productivity of 100 lines per hour and 200 lines per hour, respectively. What is the reason for the difference in productivity?
The average picking productivity of two warehouses is X orders per picker per hour and 2X orders per picker per hour, respectively. What is the reason for the productivity difference?
A large warehouse yard wants to automate the process of assigning bays for loading and unloading vehicles. Which technology can help the warehouse yard?
What is an example of short-term planning in warehouse management?
choices: Budget planning based on expansion projections
Demand planning based on market requirements
Capacity planning based on business growth
Workload planning based on order receipts
questions.correct: Workload planning based on order receipts

questions.question: Which operational metric can help a corporation improve its warehouse employee safety statistics?

A warehouse received a vehicle with stock on the twelfth day of the month and moved it to the storage location on the fifteenth day of the month. The customers order for the product was received on the sixteenth day of the same month, and it was dispatched on the seventeenth. What is the put-away cycle time for this operation?

Four warehouses have annual stock turnover ratios of the following:
W:4 X:5 Y:8 Z:10 
Which warehouse holds the lowest level of inventory?
A company wants to improve its put-away efficiency across its storage network by using advanced systems. Which system can help the company achieve this goal?
